Reviews.Title: “Noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was very hot in the room. No double windows, the traffic noise was really loud in the night. There was only one channel working in TV. The floor was crunching. Only very hot water came out of the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting - Staff Unfriendly-Star Crown Hotels Do not stay”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: I am currently in London on business and i am not into the best hotels, i like it clean with friendly staff and some space. Currently staying in Room 302 my suit case is in the what suppose to be a entrance and i have to walk over it to the so called bathroom. I asked reception at 11.00 pm for an iron and they would not give me one with out a credit card, they say that they get stolen. Is it any wonder wen you see it. The room has no space and the cold air is coming in the window. Do not stay here no matter how hard up you are!!! Star Crown hotels operate it i have taken images which i will upload later going to get moved by the company in the morning, i have tried to get up from the desk and the chair is stuck against the bed. I am dreading tonight

Reviews.Title: “Norfolk Tower Hotel London”
Reviews.Author: Reesa00
Reviews.Content: A nice hotell with small but clean rooms. Perfekt for the weekend trip. The busstop is just outside the hotel and there is no problem to take the bus to and from Viktoria station. Really nice and friendly staff. About 20 min walk to Oxford Street.

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness we only booked for one night - total time in hotel 10 hours”
Reviews.Author: 64holidaygirl
Reviews.Content: Friendly reception staff and willing to store luggage BUT the rest of the hotel experience was awful!! We stayed in Room 202 - Oh my goodness! Never have we stayed in such a tatty, grotty room! The decor was very dated - the furniture from the 1950's, mould in the bathroom, leaking toilet, window that did not close, broken lampshade the website pictures were not representative of our room. Really misleading - does this room really exist in the hotel? Found the hotel on the internet and booked due to the pleasant picture of a "Triple Room". Our room was sold as a Triple but was a twin with a fold up bed as the third bed - not great for our 14 year old. Very minimal space - I had to climb over the fold up bed to get into bed. The furniture has seen many decades!! Wooden panelled headboard with integrated radio - probably very modern in 1950's but no longer in operation. The bathroom was grim with black mould between all the tiles. We arrived at 11pm - so decided just to get into bed and sleep. We had checked out by 9am - couldn't stay for a minute longer than necessary. We didn't even bother to try the breakfast. Beware - you have been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “poor room!”
Reviews.Author: gjpMonmouthshire
Reviews.Content: Firstly the good news - helpful staff - we arrived early with our luggage stored for us. We requested additional tea making supplies from the desk and they were given with a smile. The central heating bolier was broken for the 2 days of our stay but additional bedding was supplied within minutes by the desk staff. Breakfast -If you want a cooked English breakfast it will cost Â£4 extra but the continental breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Times are 7am to 10 am which allowing for the turnover means no problems with tables. The location is ideal for Paddington station -just a couple of minutes away. Now the bad news - The room was 508 which is on the top floor in the corner. It is obviously a converted attic with sloping walls. The double bed leaves about a foot clearance at the bottom. There is no wardobe just two short posts fixed to the wall each containing 2 hangers. Had the window been clear we would have had a nice view of St Marys Hospital but in fairness we were not there for the hotel room. The carpet was threadbare and there were broken floor tiles in the bathroom. The room had an air of neglect about it and needed decoration. In fairness it was clean and the double bed was very comfortable. As regards the rest of the hotel facilities -well really they were not upto much! Cads the 'cafe/bar' in the basement was exactly that - a dingy basement room with an outside entrance with a large tv at one end that advertisies itself as the cheapest beer in the area . A candle-light supper it is not! Reading other reviews its quite clear that the top floor (5) should be avoided at all costs. This is not a hotel that you would wish to spend too much time in but for an overnight stay -provided you get a good room is acceptable. If other contributors wish to add anything perhaps they can state their room and/or floor number?

Reviews.Title: “GOOD AND BAD”
Reviews.Author: Kerry W
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed at this hotel on the 27th january-29th january. Before we arrived i decided to upgrade our room to an executive suit as they looked lovely in the pictures, but i also had to pay a little more money on arrival which i expected. what i didnt expect was to be given a crappy little room which they told me was EXECUTIVE when it clearly had just been painted, not only was i annoyed that i had been given a standard room but i also had paid extra money to stay in there! I went to reception to ask about my room and they said they do have two types of executive rooms, the ones on the top floor (where i was) and the ones on the ground floor. TAKE NOTE the executive rooms on the ground floor are in pristine condition and look amazing! unlucky for me, i was given a 'crap' executive room. Be warned that the lift does take AGES to reach you, and when it does you can only fit about 3 people inside. we did take the stairs a couple of times, but they were steep and unlevel. The bathrooms in the place are tiny, only one person at a time and you cant turn around in there atall! on a more positive note, the hotel staff are very polite and friendly, the free continental breakfast we recieved was extremely satisfying and also the location is perfect as its only a 15 minute walk to oxford street and a 5 minute walk to hyde park! would i stay here again? yes if i was sure i was getting a ground floor executive room if not then NO.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Helen B
Reviews.Content: I also read the reviews after booking this hotel & dreaded what was ahead. I was pleasently surprised. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My room was a twin room and quite spacious 219. The carpets were not threadbare and the beds were adequately comfortable. I did not go for the view from the window so it did not matter that there was none. The bathroom was fresh & clean. I have stayed in more luxurious hotels but I felt this was really good value for money & ideally located. I had no problem with Internet access. Well done Norfolk Towers.

Reviews.Title: “For us it was good”
Reviews.Author: Cutbill
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel couldn't fault it. The staff are nice, room G4 very nice and clean. We shall stay again well done NorthFolk Towers

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Westbury1907
Reviews.Content: For us this hotel was ideal, 5 min walk from Paddington Station with easy access to the tube station and only 5 stops from central London. Luxurious it is not. The rooms are tiny and the bath's are smaller than they are in Japan! The hotel is very outdated but it's clean and the staff are helpful. If your just looking for somewhere to rest your head after a day off sightseeing or shopping this hotel is fine, if your looking for a hotel break...avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: careu73
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Economy class. It's not 5 stars hotel so I wouldn't complain. The hotel is age-worn but it is clean. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Well located. Just 5 minutes walk to Paddington station. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: Helen N
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room at this hotel and was given a box room in the attic, a long way from the presentable reception area. The room was extremely shabby - worn carpets, dirty net curtains and peeling windowsill next to the bed, whic was only a folding camp bed on wheels. The 'view' out of my bedroom window was disgusting - full of rubbish. Not sure how an hotel like this gets 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel?!”
Reviews.Author: Karl D
Reviews.Content: An absolute wonderful hotel if you like sleeping in a closet. Beyond cramped, feels like a fire trap. Outrageous price-quality ratio (price steep - quality not available). Feels like an assembly line where they don't know which product they are making. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: milebush
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while in London for daughter's graduation - chose hotel for proximity to Paddington Heathrow express -v early flight. Left luggage AM ..umnderstandably too early for room to be ready. Very helpful receptionist. Changed clothed, left luggage and informed them I would be back late. Upon arrival at 11.30PM was informed there were no single rooms left, and I had been upgraded to a Club room. Very comfortable nicely decorated, lovely bathroom. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “30 years between trips was too soon”
Reviews.Author: leekstone
Reviews.Content: Stopped here with my Girlfriend in October. I had visited 30 years ago with the school so booked on a nostalgic whim. The rooms are dirty, dated, the bed was two single mattresses pushed together. The view from our window overlooked a rubbish tip of the next door hotel I will leave it another 50 years before I visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Not surprising”
Reviews.Author: Kate P
Reviews.Content: It was the cheapest hotel with availability. As others have said, yes, the room was small and out dated. The front facade definately doesn't match the interior. For 80 a night, I would have liked better, but I wasn't in London for the hotel. The bed was bad. I wouldn't have wanted to spend any more than the two nights we did on it. The location wasn't that great either. After a long day of sight seeing, it seemed like the longest walk in the world from the underground. The bathroom was a very tight fit, and to make it worse, the door automatically closes on you without any way to prop it open. There is pretty good wifi in the rooms. A man in a cafe across the street pointed out real-estate prices in the area. He guessed immediately that I was staying in a tiny nasty out dated room as soon as i mentioned the place. It might just be too expensive to update at the moment. Seeing as the manager has been responding to the reviews: With so many poor reviews, you may want to either consider updating the rooms, or pushing people towards the executive rooms you keep mentioning. Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: missnickic
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very nice. However the room was very small, the bed was very uncomfortable, the towels were old. The carpet was worn bare. The t.v. was tiny and our room was very noisy I think the walls were plasterboard. The location was excellent for what we wanted, but if you are looking for comfort this is not the hotel, Its not cheap and not cheerful. We paid an extra Â£5 for breakfasts and it was not worth it. The sausages were burnt the scrambled eggs were watery.

Reviews.Title: “poor beds”
Reviews.Author: CeciliaRR
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 beds room, one is folding bed, the other 2 are single. I guess rooms for double bed or twin bed are better but this bed I am staying is like a hole in the middle....

Reviews.Title: “norfolk towers DONT GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: ferrymanBirkenhead
Reviews.Content: given room in loft on fifth floor en suite it said worlds smallest bath like bathing in a bucket en suite 6foot by 4 foot so small its hard to turn around bedroom small again no wardrobes just a few coat hangers 1 bedside cabinet cant fit another 1 in its that small double glazed window you cant see through full of condensation carpets smell a bit. 1 lift you can wait ages to get down to get out of there into some fresh air .breakfast continental style sweaty tinned ham kraft plastic cheese.DONT GO NEAR THIS PLACE its like the fairground crazy house sloping walls house of mirrors to make it look bigger what a waste of good money this so called hotel is I would rather sleeep under the embankment than stay here again

Reviews.Title: “filthy room”
Reviews.Author: AlicebroughtyFerry
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 nights with tickets for a show with Superbreaks The room we were shown was absolutely disgusting and Vali on reception said he couldn't do anything at that time we walked out and booked into another hotel When I contacted Superbreak I spoke to Ann who was most unhelful and said I had to contact their customer satisfaction dept Superbreak will not get any more money from us !!

Reviews.Title: “One sentence? One word 'S**thole!!'”
Reviews.Author: WF1ers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the vilest place on earth, it is a dump! The 'double' room was in fact a single with a double bed squeezed in?! The bathroom door could not be closed if you were sat on the toilet and if you wanted to get dressed you had a run down tower block like something off trainspotting opposite who could see straight in to watch you! The Walls were filthy, the floor on a slant, the carpet worn to the bone. As a Brit I was ashamed that people from other country's were staying here and hoped they didn't think the UK lived in squalar!! Please take heed the reception is deceptive and the photos on the internet are fake, I will be taking this up with the trades description act and ABTA. Avoid this dump at all costs it disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Pz23
Reviews.Content: I feel sorry for the staff here, they were highly welcoming and very useful. However they have to visit this place all the time. But this is quite possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms were extremely outdated, I doubt it has had so much as a lick of paint since at least the 80s. The bathroom was very basic, unclean and the shower cold. There was no air-con and the windows just about opened! To sum it up, if I had pets, I wouldnâ€™t let them stay here!

Reviews.Title: “People. Believe the bad reviews. They're all TRUE!!!”
Reviews.Author: consumersrule
Reviews.Content: This has got to be one of the worst hotels on the planet! The rooms are small, shabby and very, very hot. No aircon and the windows don't open more than 20cm - I had to jam ours open with a toilet roll! I thought if I had a shower that would cool me down. The shower didn't work; just as well really because the thermostat came off in my hand. I tried to run the bath, but the water jut came out in a tiny trickle of scolding hot water. So, no bath, no shower and it turned out no TV because the reception was too poor to receive anything but BBC1. I could have spent the evening admiring the view, but the only thing to see was a pile of stinking refuse below my window, so I decided to count the rats instead! I went to bed. Pulling back the sheets I thought "if I ignore the stains will they go away?" My stay was not going to get any better. In the morning we went down to breakfast and my daughter chose a bread roll and I chose toast. The roll was so stale her knife couldn't penetrate it and my toast was barely more than warmed, limp white sliced bread. As I picked the fly out of my orange juice I decided that 12 hours at the Norfolk Towers was 12 hours too long. Believe it all folks and more...this is a joke of a hotel where the only high standard of service you'll find is how quickly and efficiently they'll deduct the non-refundable room charge from your credit card!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if at all possible”
Reviews.Author: macaferi
Reviews.Content: The only good things about this hotel are that it is close to Paddington Station, the shower water pressure is OK and it is clean. However the standard room is like a shoebox - couldn't open more than one suitcase at a time. No ventilation beyond a window that barely opens and, of course, no air conditioning. Only a very small lift (no stairs) that can't cope with the number of people accessing it. A continental breakfast is included but hotel guests were waiting in a queue for available tables. Definitely give it a miss if you have an alternative. It was by far the worst hotel in our 4 weeks of traveling through Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Pound01
Reviews.Content: We returned last night from a 2 night trip to london and felt compeled to write a review. Before we left my partner read the reviews and panicked (I thought it was a mistake as we couldn't change the hotel but now I'm glad he did.) We were going to the hotel under the impression that it was some god forsaken place. It is true that you should not be fooled by the reception area which is rather grand compared to the rest of the hotel. The lift is small and you have to wait for people to make their trips on occasions. The hotel could do with updating it's true and in places it's a bit shabby but our room was clean our bathroom a reasonable size and our shower was very good. The window didn't open very wide but we had and AC tower which was very good. The staff were very friendly and always said good morning. Breakfast was ok a bit limited but if you are willing to pay the Â£4 (which the member of staff told us about when we gave the room number) the cooked breakfast is very good. As an added tip: If you decide before you go into the dining room you want the cooked breakfast then tell the memebr of staff who greets you to save them coming up to you when you're getting your breakfast. In all fairness to them the room is very busy and they have to keep track of who has it or not. The dining room is maybe a bit on the small side (but I've been in smaller0 and we did at one point have to share but we simply moved our table accross. Our biggest issues was that our room was on the road and the double glazing was next to useless and so it was noisey, the hotel was very warm which in the weather we had was far too hot and we could've done with 2 pillows so I would take my own. I would stay again but not for the type of trip we went on which was shows and sightseeing as paddington is quite for on the tube. I sympathise with those who paid alot for this hotel as then I would be disapointed and annoyed but through a package deal with theatre tickets we only ended up paying just over Â£50 a night and for that price in London this hotel is luxury. Anyone who stays and says it's small I recommend you stay at a certain Bright orange company hotel as those rooms were ridiculous and far more expensive. For the same price I stayed in another hotel in londons where the breakfast room was tiny (i.e there was a que up the stairs for it) and we didn't have an en-suite. This hotel is by no means the best but I would recomend it if your just using it as a base and you've had a good price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad...........”
Reviews.Author: jlarbc
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in London for a concert at the O2. We tried to book at the last minute to get a good deal, but did not realise that Take That were playing at Wembley the same night. The only reasonably priced room available was at the Norfolk Towers. They inflated the price to Â£189 and reduced it to Â£179 to seal the booking (This was for one night!!) It is in a good location for central London and the breakfast was ok. This is where the good news ends. Although the room was clean, we were transported back in time to 1978!! Don't expect too much and you won't be too annoyed. If you plan a 70's weekend, this maybe the final piece of the jigsaw - pack your flares......

Reviews.Title: “Health Hazard!”
Reviews.Author: ichigo4
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks reasonable from the outside. However, when we arrived at the reception it was clear it was in need of rennovation. The hotel room was dated and also in need of a freshen-up. We went out for the evening and came back to a sewage smell in our room. I immediately went to reception and was informed that there were no other rooms available and received no apology for this smell. If it had not been so late at night I would have looked for another hotel. The room was very hot (no ac or fan available), there was clearly not enough ventilation and the window remained condensed for the full 24 hrs we were there. The shower was almost useless as it only provided a small dribble of water. The bed was very uncomfortable and the mattress was needing replaced. The next morning I went down for breakfast and as I was going up to get some more food, my table was cleared and someone was sat down at my table. I asked where they had put my food and bag and they simply looked at me with a blank expression. The supervisor then came over and apologised and I had to find another table to sit at. After this incident, I asked to speak to the manager who was conveniently 'unavailable'. They offered no apology and clearly did not care if I had any concerns about my stay. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL - IT IS A PUBLIC HEALTH RISK!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerDevon
Reviews.Content: Great location for Paddington, lovely entrance, friendly reception and able to leave luggage. What a pity and disappointment then that the room left much to be desired. The threadbare carpets don't actually fit the floor - concrete and holes are showing at the sides. Bathroom was dated, only one window opened and that wasn't very wide, and there are black marks all over the wallpaper. No shampoo or conditioner, only the Dove showergel dispenser. No biscuits! However, the part that disappointed us the most was breakfast. Luckily we made it down just before the queue built up, but nevertheless had to share a table with a couple of business men. We decided to plump for the Â£4.00 extra full English rather than just the continental buffet, and were happy to do so. But - there were no sauces, brown nor red. We asked three different members of staff for sauce and were fobbed off each time. We then found out after asking again that the ketchup was in the bar, the bar was locked and they didn't have the keys! It seems so trivial but surely sauce is a basic component of breakfast?! By this time the breakfast was cold, but I decided having started to go back upstairs to reception and explain that the staff in the breakfast room couldn't get the ketchup as they didn't have the keys to the bar. One phone call from reception downstairs, and five minutes later the ketchup appeared. What a fuss about nothing! The staff, until the ketchup arrived, were very rude, and couldn't put together a coherent answer. Only when we were asked to sign off the Â£4 extra on the receipt did we receive an ingratiating smile from the older waitress. Poor service and poor hotel. Don't go there if you want a special break and don't want something to mar your experience. I felt so sorry for my boyfriend who booked this with the theatre through Superbreaks for my birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty poor!”
Reviews.Author: Bigchocciefan
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I was expecting BAD things after reading the reviews on here. And yes, it was pretty bad. As per the general theme, rooms were hot not helped by the window only opening 6" or so and even that having to be propped up by a toilet roll! Very shabby furniture. But for us as a group who were visiting for pleasure, we werent actually in it much and it did the job. Positives were that the room was clean and the breakfast was ok. Wouldnt choose to stay here again though!

Reviews.Title: “Flat out sucks!”
Reviews.Author: RIchard_62868
Reviews.Content: This is the first time i have nothing poitive to say about a hotel. They advertise air conditioning, but give you a fan. The room was so hot we sweat!! This was with window open and about 50 degrees out!! We would leave it plugged in, and they would unplug it. You can not check in early. They charge an extra 4 pounds for regular breakfast. They came to breakfast and told my mother-in-law that they needed her to switch rooms on the last day there!! Her room had leaked into the one below causing problems, They put her in a smaller room. The interior is in great need of repair, missing paint, trim et al. So look at the photo of the front door, and realize thats the nicest part. I lied, 1 positive thing, It is only 1 block to the underground............they cant be applauded for that.

Reviews.Title: “Low rent hotel charging 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: morley99999
Reviews.Content: From the outside it looks ok, the rooms are another storey. I would have been annoyed to have been charged Â£85 a night for this let alone over Â£300. Run down, tired rooms, window had an inch gap around it, room was red hot. Fire Alarm false alarms twice. I'll be supreised if they get any return business but given its location I guess thats not high on their priority list.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Monj81
Reviews.Content: Absolutely terrible. The decor was from the 60s, it wasn't clean and it was extremely hot as soon as I went to my room on the 4th floor. The window opened about 2 inches and the room, despite booking a double room was a twin! The bed was really soft and uncomfortable. I've travelled and stayed in hostels but this place was loads worse. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Are You Kidding Me?!?!?!?”
Reviews.Author: BadFiggle
Reviews.Content: This place didn't look too bad - from outside. Reception needed an update. Then I got to my room. I have never been so disappointed in my life! I had a meeting that I had to get to so left my case in the room & thought I'd sort it out on my return. Big mistake! When I got back the snotty guy on reception asked why I wanted to change rooms. I explained that my room was foul, the view from my window was a whole host of broken beds, broken drawers & other rubbish piled high. The ground floor room was not safe as the window opened enough for anybody to try in. The blind on the window did nothing to keep light out. The room did not look clean. No wardrobe. Just x2short poles sticking out of the wall. I was told that there were no other rooms. Asked why I hadn't asked to change rooms earlier and then told I was only staying obe night and had shoulders shrugged at me. Shocked by the place & complete lack of service! Disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness it was only 1 night!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GN6586
Reviews.Content: Arrived in London early on a Saturday afternoon and as it was a lovely day we decided to walk from Euston station to the hotel which took us around 40mins. Upon arrival the hotel from the outside looked quite good and even the reception area seemed ok, although building work seemed to be going on. We were told our room was on the 5th floor and directed to the lift, it was here I began to doubt our choice of hotel. The lift when it eventually appeared was tiny and felt overcrowded with just the two of us in it. We eventually reached the 5th floor and our room. As soon as the door opened our hearts sank, I thought we had been allocated a loft conversion, the once magnolia painted walls were dirty and cracked the supposedly white skirting boards were scuffed and dirty, the furniture had certainly seen its better days the 60's most probably, also a roller blind instead of curtains. The bathroom matched the room with its dirty grouting and leaking shower. I thought i'd switch the TV on and surprise, surprise it only picked up one station!!! We decided that we would spend as little time as possible in the room so went out earlier than we had planned. When we reluctantly returned to our room, and decided to go to bed, I had to climb over the bed in order to get into my side as there was not enough room to walk round. All in all I realise that if we had wanted luxury we would have paid a great deal more, but even so after paying what we did you would expect at least a standard of comfort and cleanliness which I'm afraid this hotel can no where near offer.

Reviews.Title: “Tired & Rundown”
Reviews.Author: UKRaj
Reviews.Content: Tired & rundown, which is how I felt after staying one night here. My room was cramped (even by London standards). No wardrobe. The shower was a dribble and the TV only tuned into one channel.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting, a real no no no, rooms awful”
Reviews.Author: ritagatt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really misleading on website, the minute you walk in you might think its ok but the minute you get to hotel room its horrendous and believe me not just our room we were a group and every room was like a dump. I dont know how its got that rating cause its really horrible accept for breakfast which is not that bad. whatever you do dont stay here. Staff are quite friendly and helpful really it aint their fault the hotel is such a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to as bad as the reviews on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Nithrin
Reviews.Content: As one other reviewer I looked at Tripadvisor after booking and wondered why. I am however an experienced traveller and have seen a lot, so I decided not to judge before hand. Often reviews are results of what expectations you have. I can only say that either was I very lucky or others had bad luck on their stay. I stayed for three nights on a vacation as a solo traveler. Arrived at the hotel quite early, but the staffed checked and got my room ready within 15 minutes. I had gotten room 503, top floor and from what I could make it was one of the refurbished rooms. Sure, it was not very big, it was a single room, but I had no plans for ballroom dancing... The radiator was on, and hot, but it was easily turned off and I could also open the window to let cool air in to the room. Being on the top floor, no noise bothered me from the street, sure, you heard it, but you're in one big city, what do you expect? Clean and functional bathroom, with the typical English shower handle and tap system, once again, you're not at home so deal with it. Extensive breakfast, fully sufficient and for a mere Â£4 you could get English Breakfast if you needed something to last longer. Clean and fresh. Free WiFi was very welcome. 5 minutes to Paddington, as many have already mentioned, but also 5 minutes to Hyde Park/Kensington Gardens. Easy to just put your running shoes on and go for some morning exercise or just a walk in this great oasis. Lancaster Gate is another Tube station very close by. I would definitively consider staying here again, perhaps I wouls specifically ask for a room on the 5th floor when booking. It is absolutely above budget standrard that you usually find in London and the combination of the pricing and the location makes it very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water, no heating, worse than a backpackers!”
Reviews.Author: billy255057
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during my recent travels in Feb 2011. The foyer is nice but do not be deceived by this. I stayed in a single room. There was no hot water... tepid only! There was a heater in the room that was switched on but it was that cool I could leave my hand on it without it even getting hot. The room was in an absolutely rundown state... the bed head was falling off the wall, the inbuild clock radio on the bedside table had nobs falling off and didn't work. The TV had only 3 channels. There was no storage space at all in the room or bathroom. The mattress had holes throughout and the spings had gone. The sheets were not warm enough and the doona thin. The carpet was ripped everywhere and generally the room was filthy. The staff were rude and didn't seem to careless about your complaints... even when addressed politely! I wouldn't let my dog sleep at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Walls paper thin good luck sleeping at night and hearing house keeping early”
Reviews.Author: Lesley L
Reviews.Content: The walls were so thin you could hear everything. The bar advertised had closed. A friend took me home after too much to drink and was charged 20 pounds to go to my room. Used to small rooms in London. Is in close walking distance to Paddington. I had to take the tube to get to where I knew I was and I know London well.

Reviews.Title: “worn and tired but fairly well located”
Reviews.Author: iaatkinson
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. we booked thru a cheap website and paid well below the price advertised in reception. As a result we had a pokey room up a separate flight of stairs. Worn, tired, radio/clock built into bedside table did not work, radiator did (like a sauna!!!!), don't take a cat, there is not enough room in the bathroom to swing it, sitting on the loo give you bad knees cause they hit the bathroom door. location though is good, 5 minutes walk to Paddington subway, breakfast v good. Plenty of eating places around. we had a fire alarm (2.30am not funny) staff had no method of accounting for guests and one long term Scottish guest spent the time telling me how he was working cash in hand not paying tax (I will tell the tax man) Probably wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep in a snake pit”
Reviews.Author: Danni909
Reviews.Content: Ok, well here goes.... I decided to book a 2 night break to London for my partners birthday, so i chose this hotel on the basis of loation and the photographs from the hotel website. After i booked it i looked at some reviews (silly order to do it i know!) and i was horrified by what i was reading. But i thought that sometimes reviews can be harsh and people have different expectations of what comfort is. We as a couple are not really fussy, we believe that you only spend time sleeping and washing in the room so belongs if the room is comfortable and spacious and also clean enough then thats good enough for us! When we walked into the hotel (11am) we were greeted by a freindly receptionist who told us that we could leave our bags with them until check in at 2pm. Great i thought! helpful staff, the reception looked ok and the location was perfect. So off we went to enjoy our first day in london. We arrived back at the hotel at around 3pm (an hour after check in) to be told that we were unable to check in because someone was in our room checking that the telephone was working. Ok i thought, fair enough, 20 minutes later we were finally allowed up. Then the real joy began, what i am about to describe here is not being over dramatic, every word i write is as true as true can be, The corridoor to our room was very hot and smelt of smoke, the carpets in the halls were fraying and the decor looked like it was fresh out of miami vice. When we arrived at our room we found a single room with a double bed squashed in the corner. Our carpet was also fraying, wallpaper was hanging off the walls, there was damp and mould on the bedroom wall. The tv looked as old as my grandfather and only had 5 channels. On the tea/coffee tray there were opened tea bags and milk cartons. In the bathroom the pipes, taps and shoer heads were covered in limescale. Our toilet did not flush properly and the bath took approx 10 mintues until the water began running hot. Back in our room, the radiator was not working properly, you either had to have it on full blast which was way too verpowering for the size of the room or you had to turn it off and be cold in the draught from the rotton window we had. Breakfast was terrible, the bread was stale and the tea tasted revolting. The only good thing about this place was the staff and the location. Please save your money and go somewhere else as this was truely the worse hotel we have EVER stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Long Live Premier Inn & Travelodge.. Don't be taken in by the photos and reception area”
Reviews.Author: tirol94
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night only for the NTA awards. Chose this hotel for Paddington our arrival and departure station, and it looked good. Reception looked good, we arrived at 2.10pm and our room wasn't ready, we were told about 15mins. We weren't offered a tea or coffee while waiting, which we would have expected being the normal goodwill gesture. However, it wasn't worth the wait, I had booked a so called Executive Room which was on the top floor. what a disgrace, the furniture was very old, the window had a navy blue blind, a terrible draught, bathroom very small, rusty handrail. Old travel kettle, a convnetional tv of which the only channel available was BBC1. I hate to think what the basic rooms were like. The twin beds were clean but the sheets were old and torn, no hair dryer, the only up to date facility in this hotel was the key card was a swipe. When we arrived back at the hotel at 11pm I asked the receptionist for some more milk which was the tiny little cartons with the peel back. I wish I hadn't bothered, there was an inquisition into why I wanted more!! I was reluctantly given them, then I mentioned the tv only having BBC he didn't believe me We woke up to damp condensed windows. We had continental breakfast, but only had toast, we did not have the enthusiasm to eat in this hotel. The best part was checking out! I paid Â£83 for this room, I could have had almost 3 nights in a modern up to date Premier Inn or Travleodge with flat screen tv modern tea & coffee facilities, hair dryer, huge rooms and guaranteed a good nights sleep.. My advice is to stick to city type hotels and keep away from these antiquated B&Bs with extortianate prices, they are all old buildings many with draughts and damp. Remember, don't judge a book by it's cover, the camera can work wonders!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BASIC BUT CENTRALLY LOCATED”
Reviews.Author: ekellyie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Norfolk Towers hotel for 3 nights. This hotel is very basic but centrally located. The entrance to the hotel was very welcoming, the staff were very kind and helpful at reception. Our room was clean but very small, the window wouldn't open and we had to get someone to fix it. In the bathroom there was an awful smell which seemed like it was coming from the pipes, we weren't the only guests who were experiencing it. The rooms need to be modernized. Breakfast was good. There is also a bar downstairs in the hotel. Paddington tube station was around the corner and a bus stop was just outside the hotel. The only noise we could hear during the night was the buses on the street beside us. I WOULDN'T STAY IN THIS HOTEL AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Completely fooled.”
Reviews.Author: PixieEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights Dec 10th to 15th 2010. Celebrating our Anniversary of 20 years the Travel agent Thompsons booked this hotel for us. Fair enough it was in a good location just 20 minutes walk to Oxford street and Marble Arch. Cads bar under the hotel is a dump used mainly by contracters, There's no fascilities for a decent evening meal, though the Â£4 extra for breakfast is the best in London. Heating in the room No 207 was overpowering, had to jam the window open with a glass under it. Staff very helpful, towels changed daily, tea and coffee in the room. Overall the hotel is tired, overpriced, and overrated. Avoid it that's my advice.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst place i have ever stayed in my life!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin1234
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here for a night as my partner was travelling to Heathrow the next day so good location for station. When we arrived it looked quite nice from the outside and reception seemed half decent, but when entering our room-WOW-i have never seen anything like it, carpets worn, damp on the walls, dirty bathroom, wallpaper peeling and an awful stale smell, as well as being the size of a box room! We asked to be moved to another room and were told the only one they could offer was a twin room with two single beds, still just as dreadful as the last but bigger. We got ready for dinner and left the room only to find the corridor smoky and smelling of smoke, not cigarette smoke-DRUGS! a very very strong smell of WEED! we told reception about this and left, when we came back the smell had gone but this had still added to the nightmare of the night i had, as the room was freezing and so much noise, the noise is a BIG issue here i hardly slept with peopel screaming at each other and shouting on the street below. this is hotel is STRONGLY NOT recommended and i will never be stepping foot anywhere near that hell hole again!

Reviews.Title: “OK but very tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Skylight
Reviews.Content: Mum and I stayed here for a few days this Oct. We had a twin room on the second floor that was towards the rear and the side of the hotel. The room was dated, very much so! The wonky floors are acceptable I guess in an old building so that was fine, the furniture was dated to the 60's/70's but doors opened and closed without a problem so they worked AOK and are functional. The curtains had fallen slightly so didn't close properly and the bathroom was clean; but that's the only nice thing about the bathroom! The showers flow was weak, and there was yukky grouting around etc. The beds were sunk in the centre. That said, the rooms and the bathroom were cleaned very well and we had clean sheets/towels each morning with the tea facilities replenished etc. The staff were very helpful and friendly and I really couldn't fault them at all. I found the hotel quiet, despite being close to the main road; traffic noise wasn't a problem at all. I was woken one night around pub kicking out time and noisy people for a few minutes but that is barely the hotels fault. Breakfast was plentiful and kept well stocked, plus the basement bar/restaurant were busy in the evenings (we drank but did not eat there). The whole hotel was clean but the place does need a good revamp/restoration. We paid Â£30pppn that included continental breakfast. It is a few minutes simple walk from Paddington station and bus stops are steps away. There are plenty of places to eat in the surrounding areas and a local Tesco for cheaper bottles of wine! I feel that for the location and the price the hotel was more than acceptable. If you want a clean budget hotel then this place is fine; if you want a modern place then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Norfolk towers more like faulty towers!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leannewigan
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for one night while in london. It was horrible,we was given room 407 and the floor was uneven, you felt drunk all the time, everything leaned on a angle!! The room was boiling in October felt like you was in Spain, the window only opened like 10cm. Everything within the room was outdated, look like I hang been changed since 1980's!! We didn't even dare to look at breakfast, after the state of the room, didn't want to eat there!!! The hotel staff was nice, but that's about it!! The location was good, and you were close to paddington station and Hyde park. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone it's a joke! Xxxxx

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL FOR PADDINGTON TRAIN AND UNDERGROUND”
Reviews.Author: irene55_10
Reviews.Content: we arrived early and were able to leave luggage and go sightseeing. on arrival back got to hotel room very small and yes tired decor, as we were only spending sleeping time it was ok. clean white bedding and clean white towels every day it was very good very noisey outside with traffic at night but did not bother us too much. the staff were excellent very friendly and helpful. enjoyed the stay in london .

Reviews.Title: “I always thought sleeping rough was free.”
Reviews.Author: SadieWinns
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given was so humid and damp that the window had condensation running onto the worn out carpet and this room had no wardrobe just hooks on the wall for clothes.The next room (309) was very small,UNBEARABLY HOT with no air circulation ,no bathroom fan,water warped doors,whole in one wall, a window that would not stay open and 'hammock' like beds.The lift was falling apart but as the electricity kept going out it was safer to walk up and down.Breakfast was meagre,with cheese sitting out on an uncovered plate in a boiling hot room with miniature croissants.This is without doubt the worst hotel we have ever stayed in anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “don't be fooled by the reception area!”
Reviews.Author: tf24
Reviews.Content: my partner booked our stay at this hotel for my birthday as my first trip to london, it was included in the theatre package. when we were on our way having driven into london we called the hotel to ask for parking advice only the lady we spoke to could not unerstand a word we were saying, we also asked when we got there for a map of the area, no maps no advice. we eventually found the car park after about half an hour looking,upon entering the reception area looked quite nice leather sofas chandellears,but when we got up to our room modern it was not! grubby finger marks everywhere, horrible bed that was really uneven to sleep on, not to mention the fact that there was no room to move around or put your case without stumbling over it...... also it was unbeliveably hot in our room we as it was 30 degrees c outside it was about 40 in the room !! we opened a window as far as it would go which was all of 15 cms no air conditioning and tiny fan that was pointless, as i lent over the the radiator to open the window i realised the radiator was on....! no wonder it was so hot! fair to say i had a terrible sleep and thank god it was only 1 night.......... will never stay again and wont be recommending it!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't swing a hamster let alone a cat!!”
Reviews.Author: Snoop62
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I were attending a conference in the area and were looking for a reasonable hotel. On checking the website of Norfolk Towers we thought it looked reasonable and was advertised as a 3 star establishment. Why on earth did we not check Tripadvisor - we usually do!!! We checked in and the reception area looked quite nice, the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. We were told there was a restaurant downstairs for the breakfast and there was also a bar downstairs. We got into the lift.... well... the control panel was wobbly and rickety..... got off the lift at level 3 and felt I'd walked into a sauna!! Found my room along the corridor.... 313 and I couldn't believe how dark, dated, shabby and extremely small this room was. I had booked a double room for single occupancy. There were 2 very small single beds with the most dated mid bed 'console' I had ever seen! The bathroom was tiny and the door hardly shut - however that was good - if I had shut the door it would have been a sauna. I went over to open the crumbly sash window.... it slid straight down again - the waste bin lodged it open for my stay! The view was horrendous - overlooking a back yard type area / walls /shabby looking buildings. Hey, I was there on business so I am used to staying in hotels without much of a view - but this took the biscuit...... Later that evening, I got ready for bed - couldn't find a light switch from my bed, out came my emergency wind-up torch! I knew it would come in useful..... The second night, I found the switch on the 'console' between the beds!! I was brave enough to test the switches... (TV/Radio switch didn't work though so I was surprised that the lights did!!!) The sheets had seen better days and felt quite 'bobbly' and everytime I turned over, the bed creaked very loudly. Couldn't sleep though.... the window lodged open for some air circulation meant that the loud humming from below carried on all night til about 4am!! Oh how I wished I had taken my ipod!! Got back the second day from the conference with my colleague and we needed a vodka! Went downstairs to 'Cads cafe bar' hotel bar???? OMG 2 women walking in there..... we felt quite uncomfortable when a room full of workmen stared!!! Surprised there was no sawdust on the floor..... The barmaid was obviously not used to serving Vodka and slimline either!! We didn't realise that it was entered as a public bar from the street. I will be sticking to Holiday Inn / Express/ Travel Lodge etc in future at least you know they're clean and of a 'No Frills' decent standard! Where Norfolk "Faulty" Towers got it's 3 stars from - well - off the back of a box of cornflakes I should think!!! DO NOT STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Room not fit for purpose!”
Reviews.Author: Karen1986
Reviews.Content: I am a customer who has just returned from a short break at your Norfolk Paddington Towers hotel and would just like to share some feedback with you about the experience which myself and partner had. Unfortunately I was unable to share this with the receptionists when checking out as she was on the phone. Firstly I must start with the postives. The hotel itself is lovely and has a lovely character and feel to it. The location of the hotel is also fantastic! I didnt have much contact with the staff but anyone I did speak to was also friendly. And now for the not so good. Our trip to London was for leisure purposes only. All we wanted from a hotel was some where close to the centre and some were at the end of the day for us to sleep. We were given room G5 on the ground floor which i can honestly say was awful. The room was far too warm and when we opened the window there was a loud noise coming from the silver thing outside it. This noise was constant and made it impossible to sleep threw. We had booked a double room, not a twin room with 2 single beds pushed together. So along with the loud noise, the incredibly warm room and the extremely uncomfortable bed i do not feel that this hotel fulfilled my expectations of a bed to sleep in while in London. As the hotel itself is lovely and the location is great i feel that more must be done to improve the quality of the bedrooms. Unfortunately I cannot say I would visit this hotel again or recommend it to anyone as I feel it fails the basic requirement of a basic bedroom to stay overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in London, you can do much better!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiabroad60
Reviews.Content: Best thing about the hotel was the receptionist, polite and friendly. The rest of the stay not good. Firstly the electronic door key did not work, back to reception, given a manual key. Open the room, 513, the noise sounded like the runway at Heathrow, plant machinery immediately above. Return to reception, offered another room, take key open up woops someone is already there! Back to reception, offered a lower std. room than what we booked, but at least it is quiet, if a bit shabby. Returning to the room after dinner it seems a trifle warm, but there is no heating on. Oh there is a fan, however it is broken! Even with the window open, and lying on top of the bed we can't sleep because of the high temperature. (We work out that there are heating pipes running under the floor of the room). In the rickety lift on the way down another customer asks how did the night go, we mentioned the heat, he had the same problem no sleep too hot and he was from Greece! The only other couple we spoke too said they were to hot as well. I have stayed in a number of London Hotels and though many are very average this place was not fit for purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Little-Fruit-Bat
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night there because my flight had been delayed but that was enough to get a good idea. The rooms are tiny and for some reason extremely warm, sauna-like I would say. Keeping the window open is not an option though, not in Westminster and during the night. Breakfast was unedible, too bad to be true.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hairybaby
Reviews.Content: We arrived in paddington at about 12 greated by a lovely receptionist who told us our room wouldnt be ready for another 2 hours (even tough i had rang and asked for an ealry check in). Promptly she checked us in. We went up in a tiny lift(not good if your closterfobic) and found our room. It was clean but bathroom left a lot to be desired. Our TV was in black and white. Our room was over looking the road and it was so noisy when the window was open. The window had to be left open as the room was like a sauna(with the heating turned off). On many occasions we asked for some details about local attractions how to get there and such we got no feedback. Staff really need to brush up on their on customer service because it was a disgrace! We asked them about westend shows they looked at us as if we had 5 heads. Breakfast was lovely the staff there were very attentive(they should be on reception in my opinon). Very close to paddington tube station definitly the best part of the stay. I work in a hotel and i am also on the front desk and i would do my best to help our guest enjoy their and give as much info as possible but we got nothing. We had to leave b4 breakfast as we had an early flight home asked reception if they could offer us an early breakfast and we were told the chef wouldnt be in untill 6.30. Since when do u need a chef to make Tea & Toast. Disgrace! The best part of our stay was Oxford street. Its must!!

Reviews.Title: “faulty towers wouldnt get a look in!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandPink
Reviews.Content: booked through late deals.ie, and to rub salt into the wound it was not cheap either. could not check in at 11.30 am as no room was available, when we returned at 3 pm the room still was not ready. room had double bed stuck into the corner of room, cigarette burns in net on window which i thought was going to fall off any time i opened it, dirty smelly curtains, ragged carpet, dated decor & so on. only 1 person could fit walking through room as bed took over the "double room". tv had 1 channel only, heating had to be manually put on using a spanner by hotel staff on numerous occasions, i could not turn it off myself either. we did not complain as we presumed we would be moved to another "double room" with other problems. cafe/bar is not open on sundays! are they for real? i would never recommend this "hotel" to anybody even though the location is great as i feel cheated to be charged so much.

Reviews.Title: “Survived to laugh about it”
Reviews.Author: scottybNotts
Reviews.Content: From the moment you set foot through the door the quirky nature of the Norfolk Towers is apparent. The first bedroom stank of cigarettes, the second I was moved to having complaned, had a howling gale blowing around the ill fitting window. The bed looked like it has seen better days with the lovely dented mattress show the signs of alot of customers. The bathroom doorway was particulary narrow a trait which was shared by all the rooms my colleagues were staying in. The furniture dated back to when the rooms last had a facelift - probably somehwere in the 70's. The Bedside console unit (picture attached) is a classic albeit no longer worked. Once I had stopped looking for faults ( which were too numerous) and fielded calls from all the colleagues staying who had identical rooms/ issues. I started to settle into the most bizarre hotel room I have ever stayed in. On the plus side the shower was hot and the breakfast was OK! When alls said and done I spent minimal time in my room (thankfully), the location was pretty good and what do you expect for Â£50 for a double with breakfast (lateroom rate). It may seem really quite bizarre but even with all its faults, for the price, I would probably stay there again but only if I needed somewhere to rest my head after a night out.

Reviews.Title: “A charming 'character' hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin6744
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This little hidden gem is simply put the best value hotel in London. Buckets of charm and character, a dynamic workforce who cannot do enough for you, and facilities that rate amongst some of the best you will find. The simple finishing touches such as the 'soviet' style bedside cabinets with integrated control systems are a humorous and ironic quirk that brings a smile to your face, whilst the half width bathroom doors ensure you can't run into your bathroom and slip on a wet tiled floor - a great health and safety feature. Tremendous value and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ServalKat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend break. Booked single room. Twin Beds - one against the wall "wood" panel to the side and at head. Other bed in centre of floor - used this and it was comfortable. Linen: Thin sheet on bed + duvet. One pillow on each bed no spares. Plenty of closet space. Hair dryer at dressing table. Bathroom small. Shower fine. Bath worn, bathroom door warped at bottom. Very warm, but they provide a fan. Window didn't stay open without wedging my shoe under it! Noisy when window open but okay when it was closed. Floor a bit creaky and crooked. Towels fine. Toiletries: Only shower gel attached to wall over bath. No soap. TV with UK channels. Free Wifi. Tea / coffee and kettle in room. Reception area comfortable nice leather sofas. Breakfast fine and included. Can get full English for a few pounds extra (didn't). Water for tea not hot enough though. Staff helpful. Great Location. Great value Â£69 per room per night! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No security Camera!”
Reviews.Author: ednorisa
Reviews.Content: No security camera in every floor except the main entrance. We are one of the 3 victims that our room been broke into. Our locked luggage been tampered and few valuable items lost. The other 2 victims were in different floors and they lost their valuable items too. We all left the building on the same night and around the same time. Strangely this burglar knew in which room we all were since we left the building around the same time unless this person checked every rooms in every floors. When we checked out, the staffs are not that friendly enough to say sorry about what happen. We stayed in other smaller and cheap hotel and they do have security camera in every floors plus they have safe box. Such hotel like norfolk towers dont have one is really strange.

Reviews.Title: “ITEMS STOLEN FROM ROOM”
Reviews.Author: SnapshotNewEngland
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay here! My friend & I had items taken from our room. After we checked into our room, we unpacked then headed out for the day. Before leaving I placed my navy blue nightgown on the bed pillow & she had hung her navy blue jersey in the wardrobe. When we returned they were gone. Management did nothing, except change the door lock. Only ones who could've gone into the room was hotel staff, & changing the locks would be silly, seeing that they have a master key to ALL the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelleCornwall
Reviews.Content: I broke my own golden rule when I booked a cheap weekend theatre break through Superbreaks and didn't read the reviews before booking. When I read them I was very worried indeed. I noted that the refurbished rooms were getting ok reviews, so before I travelled I rang the hotel and asked about these rooms. I was told they were the executive rooms, but that I probably could have one, they couldn't promise though.I chose the hotel for it's proximity to Paddington station, and it was only about 5 minutes walk away. When I arrived, I was indeed given an executive room, on the 5th floor. First impressions of the hotel, the public area was very nice, clean, and the reception staff helpful. Took the lift to the 5th floor as I have not been well recently and couldn't face the stairs. It was a tiny lift, quite shabby and the notice said it took no more than 6 people. To be honest, I was in there with one other person and felt uncomfortably close, so any more would have been out of the question for me. The room itself was a very small single. No wardrobe (no room for one!) but a stick attached to the wall with coat hangers on there. TV on a trolley so I could arrange it to suit, discovered later that the 1 button on the remote didn't work, so couldn't get BBC1, but as I was only there for one night and was going out anyway, didn't worry too much. Bed was comfy enough, but because of the room location, the wall next to the bed sloped inwards, so I bashed my arm quite a bit when I turned over. Bathroom was fine, small but clean. Anyone any bigger than me might have a problem as my knees were against the bath while I was on the toilet (ok, TMI). The temperature was fine, but although I was on the 5th floor, I still heard a lot of street noise, and in the morning the noise of the wind was terrible. Ok, so it was windy, but this sounded like there was a hurricane going on! I was mentally preparing to give the hotel an ok review, till it came to breakfast. Not much you can do to spoil a continental breakfast? Think again! First off tried croisants. They were rock hard. The yogurt was the cheapest you can get without getting ASDA basics, very thin and not a lot of taste. Looked at the fruit salad, it was just cut up apple, so didn't bother with that. So I thought, ok, have some toast, a do it yourself affair, but then most are these days. Took a bite and had to leave it, it was the cheapest bread going, and not at all tasty. There were cerials available, and some dodgy looking cheese, but I didn't bother with this and just left. So, to sum up, if you are on a tight budget and can get a good deal, then it's ok, but to my mind there are a lot better hotels at not much more money you could go for.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: lois17
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were given a room that was old fashioned and awful it had a view of a flat roof and equipment which kept us awake all night. The bathroom was tiny and needed a revamp the fittings were covered in limescale and the door was peeling from the bottom upwards; obvious water damage. After viewing the room we went to reception and asked politely if we could have a different room, we were told, no they were full. We thought we could make the best of it! While dressing for an evening at a black tie event I stood infront of the full length mirror, my bare foot was on wet carpet, hopefully only a leaking radiator and nothing more suspicious! The tv was pure joy, not, even the remote control was held together, and the batteries in it, by cellotape! A sleepless night was spent in a hot room with scratchy bedding to be greeted the next morning by a cold full english breakfast, my friend demonstrated to the waitress her sausages were cold and un -cutable by bashing one against the side of her plate, luckily the cold plate did not break. The waitress said nothing! As we had already paid in advance when we made our comments to the receptionist she told us to write a letter with no offer of compensation. This I did and a month later (not holding my breath) a reply is so far no where to be seen. If you want to experience all things in life do try this hotel if just for the joke factor, but if you want somewhere even just ok I would not bother

Reviews.Title: “Top class in every way”
Reviews.Author: Travellerandkids
Reviews.Content: From the momment you step foot outside The Norfolk Towers Hotel you are greeted with a friendly welcome, that friendly welcome opens the taxi door, suitcases are taken care of, infact you are made to feel like royalty, the welcome from the reception staff is superb! I came with my 3 children (1 in a pram) and my mum to, we had the family room next to the reception desk. Very spacious room, 3 single beds, and very clean, extra towels given, bath/shower was very clean. There was no cot available for the baby on our arrival, no problem! Even at god knows what time of the night the staff happily got a mattress from another room, put it on the floor and surrounded it with pillows. I didn't have to do a thing. Breakfast was very filling and served with a smile even so early in the morning!- No complaints at all, they even helped with baby's food and chatted away with my two toddlers whilst mum and myself ate. Nobody minded if children where about the reception area, playing games or reading books, when the staff had a few minutes they chatted happily to the little ones and adults alike, Tea/coffee making service in room, refills given when needed, right down to baby's bottle being warmed for me..- Top class staff with a top class service given 24/7! Hotel is not far from local shops, within walking distance of train station, tube ect,

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers is 5 star Next to this place”
Reviews.Author: martmcgrgr
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the worst Hotels I have ever used. Despite the public areas being clean and carpets seem to be in good condition and relatively new. It is when you hit the rooms that the shock sets in. The carpets were worn, everything was dated (circa 1970), Bathroom was filthy, tiles were cracked, grout was black and mouldy, the taps wer so scaled up, there was "hair" in the bath. The room was like an oven, depite using a fan, having the window open as wide as it would go and the heating allegedly switched off. When I approached the staff they were very unhelpful and apathetic. I even spoke to the manager and he did not seem to care that I was far from satisfied with my room. I pointed out that I had asked to be moved which was met with a grunt. So if you are unfortunate to stay here and are offered room 314, tell them where thay can stick ther key.

Reviews.Title: “Good position but badly in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: tanyabub
Reviews.Content: Only there for 2 nights which was probably just as well. As has been said before by others the room was like an oven, even though the radiator was cold. We did have a tower fan in our room and we had to have it on full all night. TV didn't work but it was 'fixed' by our last evening but with no remote control. The room was clean but very small, the carpet was threadbare and floorboards creaky and sloping. Bathroom also clean but very small and a little the worse for wear too. Our room was fourth floor and on the front corner facing the main road but we didn't consider it noisy, although we did have our fan on full the whole time. The choices for the continental breakfast were good and you could have as much as you wanted. Hotel seemed busy so it makes you wonder what they spend their profits on.....it's clearly not maintanance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great for budget hotel, some reviews unjustified from our experience”
Reviews.Author: AileenGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel direct after surfing the net looking for a budget hotel for a city break from me, mum and daughter. On reading the other reviews I was really concerned what I was going to. However, the location is second to none - 2 minute walk from Paddington Station. On entering the hotel we were pleased. We asked to see our room prior to checking in. Our room was on the 5th floor. It was adequate, double bed and a single bed with lovely en suite facilities, tv, hairdryer and tea/coffee making facilities. The room was clean and although not huge there was plenty room for the three of us. The beds were comfy, but the room was hot. We left the window open all the time. Our room was at the back of the hotel, so we had no noise although the view was of backcourts, but hey we not there for the view!! Breakfast was a continental breakfast and had plenty, cereal, toast, croissants, hot bread rolls, yoghurt, cheese, fruit juices etc. More than enough to start your day., You could upgrade to english breakfast for Â£4 per head. Maid service was daily with clean towels daily and bedding changed on second day. Check out was 11am, but our flight home was not until 9pm so they had a lugguage store and we left it there until 5pm. The staff were helpful. I would recommend this hotel for a short break on a budget. For the people who had bad experiences I think they are looking for the Hilton at Norfolk Towers prices, if you want the Hilton pay for the Hilton!!

Reviews.Title: “A special "en-suite" room!”
Reviews.Author: Linghung
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through easytobook.com which gave a very good deal of 35 pounds for a single en-suite room. Sounds great, doesn't it? Well, everything is ok apart from the bathroom. The bathroom (though exclusively used by me) was located in another end of the corridor and I have to use a key to access into the bathroom whenever I wish to! Yet, give it is only 35 pounds (including contential breakfast) and the standard of the bedroom, I'd say this very special en-suite is not too bad. My room was located on the G/F facing the main traffic which made it quite noisy throughout the night.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: St Just in Roseland, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money tries to be a 3 # hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pagandave
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the money room was ok staff helpful and relaxed, fair bit of street noise during the night

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible - a total dump.”
Reviews.Author: DolphinsNC
Reviews.Content: Norfolk Towers should not be rated as a 3-star hotel. It is a total dump. I felt totally scammed by Priceline.com and my first experience with Priceline will be my last. When you enter the lobby, you are thinking 'ok not too bad'. Take the stairs to your room, you change you mind. Stairs are borderline dangerous as they are warped. Got to our room to find a large gap between the floor and the bottom of the door. I am talking 2-3 inches. Had to plug up the gap with 2 towels. The room had a noticeable slope to it from right to left as you enter the room. No deadbolt on the door. I wouldn't dream of leaving anything valuable in these rooms. Carpeting was filthy and coming up in several places along the wall. Our room had two single beds - pushed them together, more carpeting came up. Oh and the night table from the 1960s between the two beds fell apart when it was bumped. Was surprised not to have bugs in the room. Blanket on one of the beds had a nice fresh stain with some kind of fluid. Called 3x to get a new one. Terrible service. No batteries in TV remote. No A/C. Windows opened to an extremely noisy corner of the building. The bathroom was clean which I expect so i can't really say that was a plus. Neighborhood was fine and within easy walking district to Paddington St. Nice bakery around the corner, good pub down the street on the corner. However, there are plently of other places to stay close to stations that have to be better. Overall, the price was outgrageous, hotel was a total dump and I felt completely scammed by Priceline so I cannot recommend. In fact, I warn you to never stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “too darn hot!”
Reviews.Author: helena45
Reviews.Content: very hot and cramped,window only opened 2 inches. clean enough but very shabby

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but ............”
Reviews.Author: kathy50Scotland
Reviews.Content: I must admit i liked the room, huge comphy bed,although the people from the bar downstairs smoked outside our window and when we went to ask the front desk about it , we were told to go have a word with them. Well considering we could hear them talking about beating people up, there was no way that was going to happen. Great location, lots of places to eat and good bus service and underground not far. My only real complaint was that when we asked the front desk to order us a cab, they got one of their friends in a fake taxi to take us, and we were charged double for the journey than a propar black cab..... so beware, they will rip you off , ask for a black cab. Also none of the staff spoke English as their first language and didnt seem to know much about the area which wasnt so good as we needed advice and couldnt get it. I would go back but make sure i got a smoke free room !!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not the best”
Reviews.Author: juliancarax55
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Room small, maybe it needs a renovation but it was clean. Staff very friendly. If you want something no more expensive is a good place, if you prefer pay more for the best it's easy to find something better

Reviews.Title: “Awful... Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: RotaryTraveler
Reviews.Content: Where to start... The worst bed I've ever slept in, noisy beyond belief, no airconditioning (oh but they do give you a lovely fan to circulate the cigarette smoke that wofts in through the windows from other guests smoking), the elevator was broken more often than working, tiny rooms and bathrooms (tiny is an understatement), and the staff were crabby, sour and unhelpful. The only thing positive I can say is that it was clean, the pub was cheap (but boring) and it was located near the tube. Don't waste your money staying here...

Reviews.Title: “would recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: totalzero
Reviews.Content: firstly the location is excellent,5 mins walk from tube/rail at paddington & bus stop right outside,staff were friendly & helpful,room was just right,nothing exceptional but good size room & bathroom which were both clean. bathroom was bit small so wouldnt suit a family but for a couple its ok. one down side would be the indoor temperature,the corridoors were very warm as was the room but we kept window open at night & wasnt disturbed by this as its a quiet street. there is also a nice chippy with reasonable prices just 50 yards from hotel & staff were ok with us taking this food back to our room. we stayed there for 4 nights & will probably stay there again. overall i would recommend staying here if your a single traveller or a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than I expected”
Reviews.Author: guorlan
Reviews.Content: I am something of an experienced traveller and have been in hundreds of hotels, including in Africa in post-conflict situartions, but this is one of the worst I have ever stayed in: the rooms are small and badly furnished, some do not even have a wardrobe, the top floor is stifling hot and on the other floors the carpets are worn and with holes. The staff are occasionally helpful and more often could not give a damn, the TVs have only the 6 free UK channels and they do not always have a remote control. They say the hotel has wi fi, but it costs GBP 5 an hour (in the Internet cafes nearby, 1 GBP). If you lose the room key, they will charge you 30 GBP! More worrying, the rack rate for a double is 190 Pounds, which is extortionate for the place. You can get deals on the web, but just STAY AWAY and trust your Tripadvisor to help you choose somewhere else! Plenty of reasonable B & Bs in the vicinity which are by far better than this horrid place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there, find some place else to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sammieArnhem
Reviews.Content: This is an old, run down hotel. Staff is barely polite, let alone friendly. Service is poor, rooms are dirty and worn. After walking just a few steps on the carpet, my socks were dirty. Our room was next to a ventilation system, very noisy and hot. We changed rooms, but the problem stayed the same. The sash window kept falling down, we ended up keeping it open by putting a roll of toiletpaper between it. Breakfast is very minimal, and not of a very good quality. The only thing this hotel has got going for it, is the location. Good connections by bus and by tube.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this Hotel at all cost.”
Reviews.Author: bittersweet_09
Reviews.Content: Worst budget hotel ever, it is not even worth a 3 stars. Trust me you wont want to go anywhere near this hotel. I had mouse running in my room at 245am which then I had to request a room change at that time. Upon check-out, unfriendly staff when trying to explain my problem with them, as they just chuff us off. Had a very bad experience and would never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but decor needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Jen30Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one evening, which was enough. Sure it was clean which is what one can hope for but the decor of the room left alot to be desired. The room we had was thankfully quiet. We arrived at 5pm and after breakfast (which was ok) we were glad to be on our way. Another good point was location.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but really noisy”
Reviews.Author: sh432
Reviews.Content: Small room as are most hotel rooms in London. Had double bed and bathroom with bath and shower. Small desk and small wardrobe also. Staff were really very friendly and helpful. Staff could not be faulted. The location so close to Paddington is superb. The one thing with this hotel is the noise. There is no double glazing and the windows offer very little noise reduction. Was difficult to sleep with all the traffic as there are regular buses and traffic passing right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jackallaround
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at Norfolk Towers again. First of all the locatin is great! only two blocks from Paddington Station (which make moving really easy), and located in beautiful Bayswater, very close to Oxford and Bond Sts., just walking distance from Notting Hill and really close to amazing Hyde Park. The hotel looks very nice and the staff was very polite and helpfull, and it was great that we could leave our laggage at the reception before checking in at 2pm. Our room was on the first floor (keep this in mind, as the lift is very slowly in this place), confortable and warm, as well as the bathroom, and it was always tidy and clean. If you're considering this hotel, just keep in mind that the wardrobe is a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “i'd rather sleep on the street”
Reviews.Author: blueboy1973
Reviews.Content: i will be brief but i regularly stay in budget hotels in London, so i know what to expect. however, i have to say this is undoubtedly the worst, here are my main concerns. 1. You need to be a prize fighter to hit the lift button hard enough to make it work. 2. The lift takes at least ten minutes to get form top to bottom (it has 5 floors) 3. The hotel is heated to a constant 200+ degrees 4. I dont know what colour the carpet is meant to be,its so threadbare 5 The TV is from the 70'S it has no remote control and you change channel by twiddling the knobs 6. The Continental breakfast was from a continent i have never been to -but it has coffee served only at lukewarm, cereals only made from chocolate, and no ham, or meats however in order to be fair there are a few positives. 1.The shower worked 2. Upgrade to full breakfast and the boiled sausage and tinned mushrooms 3. The sex shop across the road next to the easy hotel made me laugh 4. Checkout

Reviews.Title: “Decent but needs updating...”
Reviews.Author: fr21555
Reviews.Content: The hotel has location going for it. It's a two minute walk to Paddington Underground, which makes hopping around London very easy. My room was the usual London budget class- which means something about the size of a Super Max prison cell. The elevator was big enough for one large person, or two Asians with luggage. You could wait quite awhile for it but climbing four flights of stairs gets old after walking around the city all day. You might want to insist on a ground floor room. The staff were friendly and had a decent command of the English language, although none would be confused with being English.
